body: @afchung I've done a pass. One minor comment. Also, did you test this on HDI?

@dafrista Looks good, I will merge.

~~This might be a problem with our master branch, not just with my change. I'm trying to run tests on various recent commits, and I'm getting these test failures starting with https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/commit/e374351a957c437f29fe9b61f3cf9f703e40ee33 (and not getting them in earlier commits). Could you please double-check?~~
Nevermind, that was caused by Java build out of sync with C# build on my machine. Indeed master branch passes tests, and this branch doesn't. Looking
Turns out that the driver can't be `internal`. I'll fix that in the merge

I've done a pass over the C# code. @beysims Can you please have a look at the bridge related code?

Regarding that: Is it possible to make an Avro schema for the `DriverRestarted` event and use that to funnel the information from one side to the other? Our bridge is growing in complexity each time we add a new API to be funneled through...

@markusweimer Addressed some comments. Do you think switching to Avro should be a separate code review? Should we do it for all the Events to be consistent? I'm not sure how Avro performance is compared to JNI calls. Thanks!

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #379](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/379/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #477](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/477/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

> Do you think switching to Avro should be a separate code review? Should we do it for all the Events to be consistent?

My comment was more generally about the bridge. It shouldn't prevent this PR from going in. That said, yes, the idea would be to have two calls in C++ in the bridge: Send Avro from C# to Java and vice versa. That would simplify the bridge code and make these reviews a lot easier.
